#summary Description and justification of feed schema
#labels Featured

The [http://code.google.com/p/jobfeed/#example exerpt on the main page] gives a partial idea of the intended form of job feeds. Take a look at a [http://code.google.com/p/jobfeed/source/browse/trunk/appengine/static/example_joblist.xml complete example].

Here is the [http://code.google.com/p/jobfeed/source/browse/trunk/appengine/static/jobfeed.xml official jobfeed schema] written in [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RELAX_NG RELAX NG]. You should [http://code.google.com/p/jobfeed/source/browse/trunk/appengine/scripts/validate.py validate] your own feed against this schema before [http://jobcrawlr.appspot.com/register submitting] it.

== job records ==
Each job record should carry the following information:
  * Nominal location
  * Lat/Lon
  * Company name
  * position title
  * minimum degree
    * degree area/concentration
  * subject matter keywords
  * required/preferred languages
  * required/preferred APIs
  * required/preferred tools
  * expiration date
